relation: they have security on campus but there are times that I feel that all they do is stand around and do nothing.
Many things to do and get involved in if you decide that you want to
Great college to start off with and a great price compared to surrounding colleges
They have a decent cafeteria on campus, but its the typical cafeteria food and nothing special
OCCC doesn't have dorms on campus that I know about. You would have to get help with finding an apartment close by.
The college is a very difficult community college but if you keep up with the work that they give you you'll get a great education for a great price.

OCCC is a great college to start off with. It's not like one of those private school where you pay an arm and a leg. And the best part is you have the opportunity to get a great education that can transfer to a grad school if that's what you decide that you would like to do.
pageTitle: Orange County Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {24945=Some tips for students that would like to apply here are aplly early to get a head start on forming your schedule before school starts in September. Always be prepared for class this shows the professor you want to learn. Try not to fail a course , if you feel like you will not pass drop the course before you earn a failing grade. Lastly, if your are having trouble grasping the material in the course there are tutors offered at the College., 46020=I will be a student as of August 27, 2012 and so far, they have helped me with my financial aid and they are friendly., 27758=This an excellent school where I got so much support and free tutoring. The teachers are personable and I learned so much. I graduated 2010., 122540=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 52417=$2100 a semester for a full time student is far cheaper than any four year school and all credits passed with a C or above transfer within the Suny system., 1554=This is a two-year college that offers the same level of education as many four-year schools. The tuition for residents of Orange County, as of 2010, was approximately $2062. For non-residents, it was about $4124, but neither of these include books.}

textAfterTable: Campus Safety Never had an instance where there was a threat Greek Life None whats so ever its a community college Great for these types of students Any type of student general ones who want to stay close to home or are being thifty when it comes to looking for the cheapest way to an education Bang for the buck Very cost-effective. Has a bridge program with many schools in the NY area What to do for fun Join clubs they tend to go on trips and do fundraisers Tips for prospective students Make sure to stay on top of your advisors about what classes you should take towards your major or you'll end up being there longer than expected In three sentences Overall good school very tough nursing program but molded towards engineering.
